E.g: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com

4.d Create Cloud Identity Services Instance

In your Subaccount, navigate to Services ‚Üí Service Marketplace ‚Üí Cloud Identity Services ‚Üí Create.

  • Plan: application

  • Runtime Environment: Other

  • Instance Name: groundingCIS

Then click Next (do not click Create yet).

In the Parameters section, enter the following JSON ‚Äî replacing <doc-grounding-instance-name> with the Document Grounding Service Instance Name you created earlier (E.g: groundingcli) ‚Äî and then click Create.

{
   "consumed-services":[
      {
         "service-instance-name":"<doc-grounding-instance-name>"
      }
   ]
}

In your Subaccount, navigate to Instances & Subscriptions ‚Üí Instances
Select your Cloud Identity Services Instance, then proceed to "Create Service Binding"

Enter a Service Binding Name, for example: cisSK, and provide the following parameters. Then click Create

{
    "credential-type": "X509_GENERATED",
    "validity": 365,
    "validity-type": "DAYS"
}

Download the Service Binding file for the Cloud Identity Services instance.

 

Step 5: Create Certificate and RSA Key Files

You‚Äôll now create two files required for secure communication between Document Grounding and Cloud Identity Services (CIS).

Open the CIS Service Binding file and copy the following values:

  • clientid

  • authorization_endpoint

Then, update the authorization_endpoint by replacing /oauth2/authorize with /oauth2/token

E.g: clientid: aaa-bbb-ccc-ddd-eee

E.g: authorization_endpoint: https://abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com/oauth2/token

Copy the certificates (there are 2 certificates) from the CIS Service Binding file (Starting with "----BEGIN CERTIFICATE---- to ----End CERTIFICATE----" and RSA key (Starting with ----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY---- to ----END RSA PRIVATE KEY----) to VSCode (or Notepad++)

In VSCode press Ctrl+H and enter "\n" in Find and "," in Replace. Select "Match Case" and click "Replace all"

After that enter "," in Find and "\n" in Replace. Select "Match Case" and "Use Regular Expression" and click "Replace all"

You will see "2 Certificates" and "1 RSA Key" similar to the screenshot below

  • Save the two certificates into a single file and save it as a .crt file.
    Example: DocumentGrounding.crt

  • Save the RSA private key as a .key file.
    Example: DocumentGrounding.key

 

Step 6: Run cURL commands to setup Document Grounding pipelines

In this step, you‚Äôll use Bruno (or any API client such as Postman) to execute cURL commands that create and configure Document Grounding pipelines in your Joule subaccount.
These pipelines establish the connection between SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition content and the Document Grounding service.

6.a Install Bruno and Create a Collection

Install Bruno: Download and install the Bruno API Client.

Open Bruno and click Create Collection

Provide a Name for the collection, for example: DGcollection, choose a Location to save it, and click Create.

Before proceeding, ensure you have the following two URLs ready:

  • IAS URL (of Joule Subaccount): https://abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com

  • Document Grounding Service Binding URL (mTLS): mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com

In Bruno, perform the following steps:

  1. Select your collection (DGcollection).

  2. Go to Client Certificates.

  3. For the Domain, enter your IAS URL ‚Äî abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com

  4. Select the Certificate File (DocumentGrounding.crt) and the Key File (DocumentGrounding.key).

  5. Click Add to save the configuration.

Repeat the same process for the Document Grounding Service Binding URL:

  • Domain: mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com

  • Certificate File: DocumentGrounding.crt

  • Key File: DocumentGrounding.key

Click Add to save the configuration.

6.b Create a Bearer Token

In this step, you‚Äôll generate an OAuth 2.0 bearer token to authenticate subsequent API calls for creating Document Grounding pipelines.

  • In Bruno, select your collection (DGcollection).

  • Click New Request and enter:

    • Name: Get Bearer Token

    • URL: Your CIS URL followed by /oauth2/token
      Example: https://abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com/oauth2/token

  • Click Create.

Add Parameters

  • client_id: (from your Cloud Identity Services binding file cisSK.json) Example: aaa-bbb-ccc-ddd-eee

  • grant_type: client_credentials

Add Headers

  • content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

  • accept: application/json

Change the method from GET to POST, click Save, then click the ‚Üí (Send) button.

You will receive a response similar to the example below.
Copy the access_token, as it will be used in the next step to create the Document Grounding Pipeline

{
  "access_token": "xyzxyzxyzxyzxyzxyzxyz",
  "token_type": "Bearer",
  "expires_in": 3600
}

üí°Tip: The bearer token is temporary ‚Äî it expires after the duration shown in expires_in (in seconds).
You‚Äôll need to generate a new access token each time you perform Document Grounding operations in the future (for example, to create, update, or refresh pipelines)

 

6.c Create a Pipeline

In Bruno, click New Request under your DGcollection.

  • Method: POST

  • URL: Your mTLS URL from the Document Grounding Service Binding, followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline
    Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline

  • Click Create.

Add Headers

  • content-type: application/json

  • Authorization: Bearer <your_access_token>
    Example: Bearer eyJqa3UiOiJ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.odHRwczovL2F6cjJpe

Add Body

  • Change the Body type to JSON and paste the following:

  • The destination is the name of the "Destination" created in your Joule subaccount" (Step 4.c)
{
  "type": "WorkZone",
  "metadata": {
    "destination": "HGDGBWZ924"
  }
}

Click Save, then click ‚Üí (Send) to execute the request

If the request is successful, the response will display a pipelineId.
This confirms that the Document Grounding Pipeline has been successfully created and linked to your SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition workspace. Copy the pipelineId from the response (E.g:  pipelineId: aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44)

 

Setup Complete

Your Document Grounding setup is now complete.
All configurations between SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, Joule, and Document Grounding have been successfully established.

Beyond the initial setup, you can perform additional operations using Bruno or cURL, such as:

  • Get all pipelines ‚Äì retrieve a list of existing Document Grounding pipelines.

  • Delete a pipeline ‚Äì remove an inactive or obsolete pipeline.

  • Trigger a pipeline ‚Äì manually refresh or re-index workspace content.

These advanced operations will be detailed in the Appendix section in the end.

 

Step 7: Verify and Test Joule

Now that the setup is complete, it‚Äôs time to test Joule. If you already have Unified Joule set up, you can launch Joule directly from the application. (E.g: Successfactors, Ariba, S/4 Private Cloud, IBP etc.)

If this is a new setup, launch Joule by navigating to Subaccounts ‚Üí Instances & Subscriptions ‚Üí Joule Instance, click the instance name to open it, and when you see ‚ÄúThe service is up and running,‚Äù copy the URL and append /joule ‚Äî for example: https://rigunifiedjoule-test-sge254ddd.eu10.sapdas.cloud.sap/joule

Before launching Joule, create a Role Collection under Subaccount ‚Üí Security ‚Üí Role Collections, add the end_user role, assign the role collection to your user in Subaccount ‚Üí Security ‚Üí Users.


Ask Joule questions related to your SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition content (files, wikis, blogs, or knowledge base articles) that were included in the grounding configuration. If everything is working correctly, Joule should return context-aware answers derived from your organization‚Äôs grounded documents.

 

Step 8: Appendix

After completing the setup, you can manage and maintain your Document Grounding pipelines using additional API operations in Bruno or cURL. These include viewing all existing pipelines, deleting or re-creating a pipeline, manually triggering executions, and checking their status.

 

8.a. Get All Pipelines

Use a GET request to retrieve all existing Document Grounding pipelines in your Joule subaccount. This allows you to verify which pipelines are active and view their associated destinations.

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) ‚Üí click New Request ‚Üí name it Get All Pipelines
Enter the MTLS URL followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline
E.g: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline

Add headers, save, and click ‚Üí (Sendüòû You will see all existing pipelines
accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>

Note: You need to get a new Bearer token if the previous token is expired. Check step 6.2 to get a new Bearer token

8.b. Delete a Pipeline

Use a DELETE request with the specific pipelineId to remove a pipeline that‚Äôs no longer needed or was incorrectly configured.

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) ‚Üí click New Request ‚Üí name it Delete Pipeline.

Enter your mTLS URL followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/<pipelineId>
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44

Add headers, save, and click ‚Üí (Send):
content-type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>
Once executed, the pipeline with the given ID will be deleted successfully

8.c. Trigger a Pipeline

Use a POST request to manually trigger a pipeline execution. This can reindex or update metadata for all grounded documents in the selected pipeline.

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) ‚Üí click New Request ‚Üí name it Trigger Pipeline
Enter your mTLS URL followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/trigger
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/trigger

Add Body

{
  "pipelineId": "aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44",
  "metadataOnly": false
}

Add Headers, save, and click ‚Üí (Send):
accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>

Once executed, the pipeline will start executing.

8.d. Check Pipeline Execution/Grounding Status of the documents

To check status of individual documents (files, wiki, knowledge article etc.)

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) ‚Üí click New Request ‚Üí name it Check Grounding Status.
URL: https://<your-mtls-url>/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/<PipelineID>/documents
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44/documents

Add Headers, save, and click ‚Üí (Send):
accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>

8.e. Check Pipeline Status & Total executions

Replicate steps from 8.d and use "status" and "executions" instead of "documents" in the URL. You will get final status or total number of executions of the pipeline 

URL: https://<your-mtls-url>/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/<PipelineID>/status OR executions

Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44/status
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44/executions

entry.title: SAP Document AI accelerates document-centric business processes with Generative AI
entry.content:
Authors: @amagnani37 & @merza 

Thank you to everyone who joined our recent partner webinar, "Streamline document processing with SAP Document AI". This session was part of our ongoing partner webinar series, "Talk to your business with Generative AI", and the turnout and engagement were fantastic.

For those who couldn't make it, or for anyone who wants a recap, we‚ÄîMerza Klaghstan, Alice Magnani, and Jacob Tan from the BTP & AI Solution Architects team ‚Äîwanted to share the key takeaways, demos, and technical insights from the session.

Our goal was to go beyond a simple feature list and show you how SAP Document AI can be the centerpiece of a complete, end-to-end business solution.

Here‚Äôs what we covered.

Part 1: What is SAP Document AI and Why Does it Matter?

We kicked off by tackling the core business problem: a staggering 70-80% of all enterprise information is unstructured. Manually processing this data from documents, emails, and scans is not only slow but also expensive and prone to errors.

SAP Document AI, formerly known as Document Information Extraction (DOX), is SAP's AI-powered solution on the Business Technology Platform (BTP) designed to solve this. It goes far beyond simple Optical Character Recognition (OCR) to extract, classify, and validate data with high precision.

Key Capabilities

We highlighted several key features:

  • Multiple Editions: The service is available in Base AI, Premium AI (which includes Generative AI capabilities), and Embedded editions to fit different use cases. We also want to highlight for our SAP Partners that the Premium AI edition is part of the Test, Demo, and Development (TDD) license, which provides a much more convenient model for your non-productive and internal development purposes.

     

  • The New "Workspace" UI: We compared the classic "Basic" UI with the new, full-featured "Workspace," which is the future of the service and includes capabilities like email channel configuration and workflow management.

    It's the new, full-featured environment for all document processing tasks . We want to emphasize that from now on, all the latest SAP Document AI features will be available in the Workspace UI only, so we strongly advise using it for all new projects.

     

  • Pre-Configured & Custom Content (Schemas): The service provides many pre-trained models (called "Schemas") for standard documents like invoices and purchase orders. The real power, however, comes from creating custom schemas for any document type your business needs‚Äîfrom specialized licenses to internal forms.

     

  • Generative AI & Instant Learning: For custom schemas, SAP Document AI leverages Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) to understand and extract information. We also demonstrated "Instant Learning," where the model learns from your manual corrections immediately. After one correction, it knows how to handle that document layout correctly the next time.

    In our demo, we showed how the model initially struggled with a name containing a middle name and extracted the wrong federation name (full name vs. acronym) . After one manual correction and confirmation, it learned immediately. Technically, this feature uses few-shots prompting to make the underlying LLM aware of your previously reviewed documents to improve accuracy on the next run.

Part 2: A Real-World Use Case: "Vertigo Travels"

To make this real, we introduced "Vertigo Travels," a fictional travel agency specializing in sports and adventure holidays. Their key challenge is managing the various kind of documents required for subscriptions, such as ID cards, medical certificates, and diving licenses.

The solution architecture includes:

  1. The Vertigo Travels website, a frontend application,  deployed in Cloud Foundry, serving as entry point for Travelers to select travel packages and upload the necessary documents, such as ID cards or medical certificates. The backend logic is a CAP (Node.js) application also deployed in a cloud Foundry.

  2. SAP Document AI, for all document intelligence operations, communicating via API with our backend application.

  3. SAP HANA Cloud, as a persistence layer for our application, to store all the entities involved in the subscription process.

  4. SAP Build Work Zone standard edition, as the entry point for Vertigo Travels employees to supervise the process. From Work Zone, business users can access the Vertigo Travel website for admin operations, or the SAP Document AI workspace, for instance to review documents. SAP Build Work Zone also allows business users to use SAP Document AI via mobile.

  5. SAP Build Process Automation, to define business rules to automate some document validation checks. Although this could also be implemented as part of the  Vertigo Travels backend application, SAP Build Process Automation enables citizen developers to modify easily the business logics when required.

  6. SAP S/4HANA Cloud, as the core SAP Cloud solution. The Vertigo Travels backend is integrated with modules such as Business Partners, Products, Sales Orders/Invoice, Customer Return for refund.

For the source code, you may refer here for reference.

P.S. if you're planning to work on this prototype, please give us a shout out~! So at least we know somebody is trying our repository out!

We demonstrated three end-to-end scenarios:

  1. The E2E Flow: A traveler, Mary, subscribes on the website and uploads her documents. A back-office employee, Barry, reviews and corrects one document in the Document AI Workspace. Once confirmed, a Sales Order is automatically created in S/4HANA Cloud.

  2. Multi-Channel Ingestion: A traveler, Luca, visits an office. The employee uses SAP Mobile Start to scan his ID and medical certificate. The system then automatically emails Luca about a missing document. He simply replies to the email with his license attached, which is automatically ingested via the Inbound Channel feature.

  3. Automation: A traveler, Claire, uploads an income statement to apply for a discount. SAP Build Process Automation runs a rule to check her eligibility. When she submits her final documents, they have a high confidence score and are auto-confirmed without any manual review.

Part 3: How We Built It (The Technical Deep Dive)

For our developer community, we walked through the "how-to" for the key components.

For the source code, you may refer here for reference.

P.S. if you're planning to work on this prototype, please give us a shout out~! So at least we know somebody is trying our repository out!

1. Setup and Schema Management: We started with the BTP setup, which involves managing entitlements, creating the service instance, and, critically, establishing trust with SAP Cloud Identity Service (IAS) for user authorization. We then showed how to create the custom schemas that power the application.

When you set up your entitlements, make sure to use the application subscription ending in -ias (Identity Authentication Service), as this is the one that provisions the new Workspace interface.

2. API-Driven Development: Our CAP application's backend communicates directly with Document AI's APIs. We showed code snippets for uploading a file (using the FileService) and processing it against a schema (using the SchemaService).

How to retrieve specific extracted values:
While our demo UI showed a simple text extraction, your application will likely need specific, structured data (like "gross_family_income" or "number_of_kids"). The API makes this straightforward:

    • After processing the document, you get a Document ID.
    • You can use this Document ID to retrieve the Document Version ID.
    • Using the Version ID, you can then query the Entities for that document. 4. Finally, you can retrieve the specific value by using the Entity ID (e.g., the ID for your "number_of_kids" field) .

This is how our automation process, for example, was able to pull only the family income and number of kids to pass to the rules engine.

3. Configuring Email Ingestion: We configured the "Channels" feature to monitor an email inbox. This required registering an app in Microsoft Azure, granting Mail.ReadWrite permissions , and then using the Document AI Workspace to map a specific email folder to our target schema.

4. Enabling SAP Mobile Start: This was a key integration for the in-office scenario. It involved three steps:

    • Adding the Document AI dependency to SAP Build Work Zone within the IAS console.
    • Creating a specific BTP destination (sapdocumentaimobilestartintegration).
    • Configuring the app tile in the Work Zone Site Manager with the correct navigation and visualization parameters (e.g., mobilestart.type = documentAi).

4. Automating Logic with SAP Build Process Automation: To keep our application logic flexible, we externalized our validation rules. We created a process in SAP Build Process Automation with a Decision Table (Rule) to calculate the family discount based on income and number of kids. This process is exposed as an API and triggered by our CAP application.

For the source code, you may refer here for reference.

P.S. if you're planning to work on this prototype, please give us a shout out~! So at least we know somebody is trying our repository out!

Part 4: Conclusion, Best Practices, and What's Next

We concluded with some key advice and a look ahead.

Best Practices & Responsible AI

  • Quality In, Quality Out: The accuracy of extraction heavily depends on the quality of your scans.
  • Human in the Loop: While automation is powerful, always design your processes with a "human in the loop" for validation, especially for critical data.
  • Responsible AI: We reiterated SAP's commitment to AI ethics. External LLM providers are carefully selected and are not permitted to store or retrain their models on customer data. Features like continuous data sharing for model improvement are strictly opt-in and should not be used for sensitive personal data.

Get Started and Look Ahead

We are committed to helping our partners build on this platform. Here are the resources to get you started:

  • SAP Document AI Official Help Page: https://url.sap/imohkv
  • Vertigo Travels GitHub Repository: https://url.sap/pi5vwn (The code for our demo app will be available here!)
  • SAP Community for AI/ML: https://url.sap/ai-ml-grp

The roadmap for SAP Document AI is packed with features, including more pre-built schemas, document workflows, custom LLM prompting, and deeper integration with Joule.

Finally, don't miss SAP TechEd Virtual! Be sure to check out sessions AI821v and AI102v for the latest roadmap and deep-dive innovations from the product team.

Please feel free to leave any questions or feedback in the comments below!

entry.title: SAP Document AI Made Simple: A Functional Analyst‚Äôs Plug-and-Play Guide
entry.content:
My initial plan was to se Boosters for Free Tier Use of SAP AI Core and SAP AI Launchpad
(Be aware- AI core and AI launchpad are not available in BTP free tier. Alas!)

Next Goal:

Build an end-to-end document AI demo that:

  1. Uploads an invoice or receipt (PDF/image)
  2. Extracts structured data using SAP Document AI API
  3. Stores the response as JSON
  4. Visualizes extracted fields in Streamlit

Architecture

[Streamlit UI] ‚Üí [BTP Destination/Service Key] ‚Üí [SAP Document AI API]

                                         ‚Üì

                             [Response JSON ‚Üí Results Display]

But hang on ‚Äì If you are a first time user of SAP BTP, ( Most of SAP business analyst, Functional consultants, SAP managers in 2025 are right at this phase- they all have heard about BTP, knows what it is used for ‚Äì but never used it hands-on ) there are too many pre requisite one after another. More interesting fact- not all of them are in a single place. You need to stitch bits and pieces to make it work. 

I researched few articles over internet even asked Walkme- but didn't get necessary answers

Assumption - Most of the folks who would read this article have SAP S-user ID from past interaction with SAP marketplace portal.

Note ‚Äì Reference: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/hcp-create-trial-account.html

To start with- Access SAP BTP Cockpit and create Global + Sub account under free BTP trial.

Once the signup process is complete, you can access the cockpit via https://cockpit.hanatrial.ondemand.com/trial/

Choose region- Either of the below- it will take up to 3 minutes to create BTP accounts.

This page below will display the current state of the subaccount. You can manage your subscriptions and jump into the different runtime environments. It also shows you fundamental; information of the Cloud Foundry environment, such as the API endpoint and the available spaces ‚Äì SAVE it as favourite (Top right corner star icon inside SAP BTP)

You may need to navigate between Global and sub account and different nodes often.

A SAP BTP subaccount is best described as a workspace for development and application deployment that provides strong isolation for security, user management, and data segregation, rather than a "client" in the traditional SAP multi-client sense. 

We can have multiple sub account inside one global BTP account

Next step-  Run Booster method to enable SAP document service

NOTE - We do not need to Manage Entitlements Using the BTP Cockpit.
Rather we shall use booster method under Global BTP account
Go to global BTP account page- click on left panel boosters as shown below

scroll down ‚Äì under artificial intelligence category

This booster helps you set up SAP Document AI in the SAP BTP cockpit.
Step by step, this booster assigns entitlements, updates your subaccount, and creates a service instance and the associated service key for SAP Document AI.

Click start

Reminder- If you close SAP BTP browser by mistake ‚Äì here is a quick link to open it again - https://cockpit.hanatrial.ondemand.com/trial/

Next go to BTP sub account ‚Äì which is visible under Global account as below- left panel you can click on account explorer

Inside sub account ->expand services - look for instances and subscriptions on left panel- shown below

We can see 2 subscriptions below by default SAP Business application studio is enabled

Next click on service marketplace

Search with AI + Enter- select 1st tile shown below

Click on Create (as I pre-created so it is greyed out)

Fill up below popup 

Tips: You should select the plan as shown below to use the SAP AI document service effectively as a plug and play from external ecosystem.

Setup your new instance as below- name as per your choice

Next ‚Äì From left panel, again go to instances and subscriptions- this time 2nd tab called instances

Note ‚Äì the difference in ‚ÄúPlan‚Äù in the setup, one is default another is blocks of 100.

Click on the credential ‚Äú1key ‚Äú and 'Form'- we explain this in details. You may download it.
1/ Url -i.e. DOC_AI_URL used by external application.

2/ TOKEN_URL = This will be needed by external apps to authenticate with BTP service.

This url has term ‚Äòauthentication‚Äô- -Tips- do not use sburl

 

Tips- when using this Token for authentication, we need to add suffix befind above url as below after ondemand.com
/oauth/token"
3/ CLIENT_ID ‚Äì That is self-explanatory- from the above screenshot, you must note down.
4/ CLIENT_SECRET - That is self-explanatory- from the above screenshot, you must note down.
Inside the key file there is another element called swagger

When we would make a call to SAP AI document services- our schema from external applications, then this swagger needs to be passed along with the document Url.

Full API endpoint (for extraction jobs)
combine "url" + "swagger"

Next- From left panel -click on Security- still within BTP sub account

Look into right panel ‚Äì click on arrow ‚Äì to navigate inside details

Click on the Role collections tab- It will show already assigned existing roles- do not get confused or search roles here. Click on assign role collections

In the below popup-search for ‚Äòdoc‚Äô and assign all of them to your BTP user

Note- without those roles you will not be able to use SAP AI doc service schema configuration- neither the external call will work.

Tips- this is crucial step-otherwise SAP BTP service call will authenticate but not be able to use your own custom schema or SAP defined standard schemas and purpose of the plug & play will be defeated.

Interestingly this role collection step you may have to do multiple times as I observed even after assignment on 1st day- next day it vanished- had to re assign.

Next go back to Instances & subsc.from left panel

Click on application = SAP doc AI shown below

A new browser widow will open as below

Tips- Without suitable role collection this arrow marked button will not appear- This is used for schema creation.

Click on schema configuration Below list of schemas will be shown- SAP_ are all standard schema provided out of box-we can use it as is or create our own schema. When we click on create ‚Äì below popup appears

As shown below I created my own schema namely invoice_ai_doc

I clicked on my schema name- copy of SAP_invoice_schema  Next ‚Äì I click on create version- I could now get ‚ÄòEdit‚Äô button enabled for both header and item fields of the invoice schema- I can click on ADD button to add my bespoke fields as shown below.

Finally click on activate the schema
Now all necessary BTP setup is ready.
Next- outside SAP ecosystem ‚Äì plug and play.
For simplicity, I shall use ‚ÄòStreamlit‚Äô an open-source Python library that allows us to create interactive web applications using pure Python and a python project on PyCharm IDE
Note- Any web application/tech. stack React, Django, Flask, JavaScript Node.js backend, Angular, CSS etc. can leverage SAP BTP Document AI service with above setup.

I created following python project in PyCharm - where I loaded secret key of SAP BTP DOC AI service instance in a safe and secure way. I have used .env and .gitignore to protect unwanted github publishing of the key details as per best practice guidelines.

A simple object class is created for this demonstration

Having 4 methods as below

Next showtime!  I run my streamlit app UI called app.py(see python project)

The frontend is displayed  below

Feature-
1/ I can test service configuration with SAP BTP authentication token
2/ Available schema
3/ Browse & Upload invoice and click ‚ÄòExtract document information‚Äô on streamlit app
a) I upload a train ticket invoice PDF

b) A sample invoice jpeg
c) A sample invoice pdf with different details.

Result ‚Äì

 

 

2nd Invoice image

3rd Invoice also uploaded for analysis and extracted on my app as below

Next ‚Äì check on SAP BTP portal, where we submitted those 3 invoices (2 pdf and 1 jpeg)

Below is the document service page, amazing!

I can also open any invoice ‚Äì example below ‚Äì It also shows ECR values right side!

Conclusion:

In a world where technology evolves faster than documentation can keep up, it‚Äôs easy for Functional Analysts to feel lost and overwhelmed. This guide bridges that gap, providing clear, step-by-step instructions to integrate SAP Document AI seamlessly with any non-SAP web application. By removing the guesswork and eliminating outdated instructions, it empowers analysts to explore, experiment, and innovate without frustration. The result? Less confusion, more confidence, and the ability to unlock the true potential of intelligent document processing in your organization.

entry.title: How to build an AI side by side extension for Fieldglass
entry.content:
In this blog post, we‚Äôll walk you through building a side-by-side extension that combines SAP BTP‚Äôs AI capabilities with Fieldglass to streamline external worker onboarding. Using a practical example, we demonstrate how to create an intelligent document validation system that automatically reviews content of worker documents (ID, criminal records, debt collection statements, and confidentiality agreements) against company guidelines. The AI-powered extension extracts key content from documents, validates it using large language models, and presents summarized findings to end users for final approval or rejection decisions. This approach with GenAI Hub to protect these sensitive information significantly reduces manual review time while ensuring compliance, with all decisions automatically documented back in Fieldglass for complete audit trails.

In this example we test with for types of documents:

  • ID
  • Debt collection
  • Criminal record
  • Confidential agreement

Architecture:

Document AI: Service to retrieve the information from the different types of documents. For each document there is a specific schema defined

HANA Cloud: Stores all the needed data for the workflow/UI. Possibility to compare document to reference document. Also stores the guidelines that are used to check the entries from the documents

SAP AI Core: Access to the different LLMs. Used to decide if the entries found with Document AI are acceptable per guideline or not. Summarizes the findings for the end user and gives recommendation

Destination Service: Stores the credentials for OAuth2 and other relevant API data to access SAP Fieldglass from the CAP application. You need to generate an API key for Fieldglass (sap help documentation)

Process Flow:

Here is a very basic overview of the process flow of the application:

 

We retrieve all workorders from Fieldglass and for all new ones we also retrieve the documents. If all documents are available for a work order we start the validation process. Validated will be ID (Name, birthday), confidential agreement (signed not signed), debt collection and credit statement are checked for entries. Results are validated over AI Core based on company guidelines. Resulting summary of findings are being displayed in the Fiori App to decide. The decision is then being sent over API to Fieldglass with a approval comment or a reject reason. The decision is being documented in Fieldglass. For each document type there is an Activity Item which has the verification setting enabled so we can accept, reject it

User interface:

The user can see the summary of the users entries, the current item being validated and the items that already have been validated. The user can also look up the original document to cross check the summary if needed.
 

APIs and endpoints:

Fieldglass APIs:

The Fieldglass APIs are, to be honest, not that straight forward üòâ

For this example we used the following APIs:

  • Activity Item Completion Upload (help, API docu)
    • To set the status of the Fieldglass Activity Items as Rejected, Completed or Verify and with the reject reason/comment
  • Work Order Delta Download (help, API docu)
    • For retrieving all the work orders. Be aware this gets you a delta since the last call! Not all Work orders
  • Worker from Work Order Download (help, API doc)
    • Fetch all information of the worker (name, security level etc.)
  • Attachment XML Download (help, <no API available in business accelerator hub)
    • For retrieving all relevant documents from a specific work order
    • Parameters need to be set like the following
      • ?object_ref=Activity Item~${workOrderID}~${activityItem}
      • The "activityItem" variable is a code you need to look up in the admin configuration  and specifies what Activity Item you want to retrieve: Go to Admin Configuration -> Activity Item -> then search for you Activity Item and get the according code

Be aware of the Fieldglass APIs ;D

  • A lot of the FG APIs accept only csv in the request body. Make sure you sent the correct value in the correct cell. Use for example Excel if you want to make sure that you entered the correct values underneath the correct header as csv can be hard to read in just plain text and you can easily enter your value in the wrong column
  • They can have spaces in the request URL. Make sure they are correctly encoded by the REST client used
  • Some APIs do not make a full read but only a delta of the underlying entities
    • You can reset the last fetch in Fieldglass if needed for testing
  • In General be very aware of the API syntax as it can be unusual when comparing to the structure of other APIs. For example the syntax of the parameters for the Attachment XML Download  with the "~"  in between. E.g. for the download the parameter differs greatly depending if you want attachments from an Activity Item or a SOW

In conclusion read the documentation very carefully on the business accelerator hub AND the help portal

How to call the Document AI Service:

To get the URL of the we bind the Document AI Service to our application and used the function "getServiceBinding" to  retrieve all the required properties (@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity package)

For starting a job in Document AI you need to set the following headers and make a POST Request:

Header field

Value

Desciption

clientId

<clientId>

You can call this Api to retrieve all client ids

documentType

<documentType>

The type of document being uploaded. Choices: 'invoice', 'paymentAdvice', 'purchaseOrder', 'businessCard', 'deliveryNote', 'resume', 'birthCertificate'
'custom' if you created one yourself

schemaId

<schemaId>

The schema you want to use for your document. (get all schemas with this api)

schemaVersion

<schemaVersion>

The version of your schema

 

Content-Type

Multipart/form-data

 

 

As a response you should receive the jobId this jobId is needed to call the service again later for the result.

In our case we configured the callback from the service, so it calls our application when the job is finished and all results have been extracted. Check this out, to see how this is done. Make sure you have created a configuration key and set "activateDocumentNotifications" to true otherwise the service will not perform a callback. Configure the destination for the callback accordingly.

When the service performs the callback with the job id you can use this to make a GET request to fetch the results of the job. This information is then used to further process the documents and later sent to AI Core.

You can use predefined schemas or you can define your own schemasd. In our case we defined custom schemas. Check out the help portal for schemas

How to call the AI Core

For using the AI Core you can use the provided SDK which fits you best. In our case as we are working with CAP and a NodeJS backend we used the SAP Cloud SDK for AI (JavaScript). We then utilized the Orchestration Service which enables us to quickly change back and forth between the difference models if needed

Set up for side by side extension with Fieldglass:

All APIs of Fieldglass are available in the business accelerator hub and in the help portal

For making HTTP requests to FG you need to have an API Key. Here is a short Joule for consultant explanation on how to do that or check out this help documentation:

Step-by-Step Instructions for API Key Generation:

  1. Access Configuration Manager Dashboard
    1. Sign into SAP Fieldglass using your standard credentials$
    2. Switch to Configuration Manager user: Click your user icon in the upper right corner and select "Linked Accounts"
    3. Navigate to the Configuration Manager dashboard - this provides access to integration tools and administrative functions
  2. Create the API Application Key
    1. Click the "API Application Keys" tile on the Configuration Manager dashboard
    2. Click "New" to create a new API key
    3. Fill out the form with the following required information:
      1. Application Name: Enter a unique, descriptive name (e.g., "SAP Start Integration")
      2. Description: Provide a clear description of the API key's purpose (e.g., "API Key for SAP Start Integration")
    4. Click "Create" to generate the API key
    5. Capture Generated Credentials

After creation, the system will display auto-generated values:

  • Application Key (auto-generated)
  • Client ID (auto-generated)
  • Client Secret (auto-generated)

!!! Important: Copy these values to a secure location immediately, as you cannot retrieve them later !!!

BTP Destination:

Create a BTP destination with the url, credentials and Oauth Url from the API key. Choose "OAuth2ClientCredentials" as Authentication. Don't know how to create a destination? Check this out!

You can now call the SAP Fieldglass APIs over this destination. In case of errors try to call SAP Fieldglass with an REST Client like Postman or Bruno

You can retrieve the destination in CAP for example with the @sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity package with the getDestination function and then make an axios call to Fieldglass

Conclusion:

Congratulations! Using the example of an AI-powered external worker document validation system, you‚Äôve learned how to build a side-by-side extension for Fieldglass with SAP BTP‚Äôs AI services. Through this practical use case, you now understand how to leverage SAP Document AI for intelligent document processing, SAP AI Core with its LLMs for automated guideline validation, and navigate the unique challenges of Fieldglass APIs - from CSV request bodies to URL encoding quirks. With this real-world example as your foundation, you‚Äôre ready to create your own intelligent automation solutions that enhance Fieldglass üöÄ

Special Thanks:
Big thanks to Leo Irudayam for his dedication, expertise and hands-on development that helped bring this PoC to life.
Special thanks also goes to Matthias Beeler for the technical implementation and realization and Sven Breuninger and Kevin Hornung for the Fieldglass expertise that made this PoC possible.

entry.title: RPT-1, Document AI, Perplexity in AI Core and co. - How to start your 2026 right with SAP's AI offer
entry.content:
AI remains years after its new wave of generative AI more omnipresent then ever in our daily lives and there not a single day passes where we don't talk about new announcements, AI ethics discussion, if it is a bubble, what amount of money is spent and so on. For those of you, who follow me, will know, that I preach all day that the key to successful AI adoption is a useful case, the right technology and working with the people.

Writing prompt guidelines is just enablement for another side-by-side tool and does not gain efficiency rather joy trying out new things. Building an agent for a pretty deterministic process might be fun and easy to implement, but expensive and unpredictable in production. And so on... While many are talking about large mainly American software vendors with their "agentic foundation killing any SaaS", SAP's offerings might not be so familiar to you (besides Joule and BDC) - so that's my motivation to provide a sneak peak of exciting topics in 2026.

Use Case: Onboarding of a new vehicle to the car fleet

In order to make tools tangible and understand the bigger picture, we will sketch an AI-assisted process of vehicle onboarding. Previously following steps were mandatory:

  1. Clerk typing vehicle data into system from the official vehicle document
  2. Vehicle Master Data Engineer adding additional information based on public search as required drivers licence and consumption values
  3. Finance expert to determine the tax amount to be paid for that year based on manual and local review
  4. Field Service Manager classifying the vehicle for the right purposes to be used

As you can see, this process is slow, very labor-intense and quite possibly error-prone. We will now step-by-step automate this by leveraging different AI tools offered by SAP within the Business AI portfolio üôÇ

Our ultimate goal is creating a low-code-first, enterprise-ready automation to avoid manual research and typing into the system:

 

Capturing of correct data: No more manual data entries from 2026 on

If you have in 2026 tasks which require typing in data from one medium (e.g. mail or paper) into your system, it's time to automate this asap. In our scenario, we do have the vehicle document on paper, as this one:

Instead of typing this, we use the SAP Start app on our iPhone to take a picture and the deep integration to SAP Document AI to process this document (see more here). We then utilise Document AI with our custom schema to extract the results and preview these to our clerk for a double-check. Instead of building entire new UIs, workflows, etc. we can now do this directly in Document AI and get a nice view of the document on the left and extraction on the right:

 

Automating web searching: Leverage the perplexity integration in SAP AI Core

SAP AI Core is the central hub for any access to MLOps activities and GenAI. With your BTP account you have access to a wide variety of partner models hosted on hyperscaler infrastructure and SAP's very own one with Mistral. If you didn't know this yet, that we have an orchestration workflow with prompt optimiser and much more, look up here which models we offer through your BTP contract.

Lately, we have added Perplexity as well - the AI-assisted search engine. Now we can connect publicly available data straight into our workflows, and it's huge, e.g.

  • classify the purchased non-catalog item to the correct product group
  • fill gaps in master data based on product sheets
  • make research on sustainability KPIs of your supplier
  • conduct analysis for B2G processes
  • get market macro trends or real-time insights, e.g. supply chain disruptions
  • ...

We will leverage the Perplexity integration to enhance our vehicle master data by the required drivers licence type for Swiss drivers licences and the energy consumption according to WLTP (an industry standard to measure consumption). We can model our prompt in SAP AI Launchpad and use the prompt registry to save it with placeholders:

And now it's so simple to add it to your pro-code app via CAP, to your low-code automation in SAP Build Process Automation or your integration flow in SAP Integration Suite:

In this iFlow you can see how we leverage the new outbound channel feature in Document AI to enrich the extraction of the results straightaway with an iFlow exposed via API management (for more, stay tuned on upcoming webinars). If you have seen in the previous screenshot of Document AI - there is a tab with "Z - additional values" üòâ

Do machine learning without data scientist: SAP's own foundational model RPT-1

Now we have been onboarding our vehicle, but we must classify for which tasks we can use it. Luckily we have already quite a large fleet and some data. Ideal for machine learning (yes that's also part of AI and yes AI is not only GenAI).

Machine learning learns from historical data - as simple as this is, this requires a data set, model fitting, model validation and deployment. Not straightforward. With Gemini, Le Chat and co. we are used to just prompt AI models. What if, we could just put a snapshot of our table to a pre-trained model and let it classify by itself. Congrats - you are now a RPT-1 user:

RPT-1 has its own playground, is accessible via AI Core and is phenomenal for transactional classification and prediction tasks. If you want to know more about its integration, I'd recommend you this gem. In my scenario, we use RPT-1 in our workflow in Build Process Automation to classify our vehicle correctly before we post it to our equipments in S/4HANA:

Performing more agentic tasks: Joule Studio

Previously you might have heard, you can use Joule Studio to make Joule truly yours. Joule Skills are intent-based automations made familiar to Joule to perform tasks conversational based. They can leverage workflows, pro-code and integrations via Integration Suite.

2025 Christmas gift, was the GA of the agent building capability in Joule where we can model agents. Agents are behaving non-deterministic and trying to mimic a human thought by providing it a scene and background - like an improvisation theatre. Now it's oftentimes pretty tricky to understand when an agent is really necessary. In our example we use an agent to determine how the vehicle tax are calculated for the Kanton St.Gallen, where we have registered our car and perform a calculation based on the perplexity web search (disclaimer - this can be modelled through a workflow in Build, it's just for the sake of simplicity):

 

Why choose SAP for your AI journey?

That's a good question and especially given there are soooo many tools on the market, why should you? It's simple: it's all about enterprise readiness. Behind every of this automation, there is only 5-10% AI, the remaining parts are security, audibility, traceability, transport management, scale resiliently in production, monitoring, low-code modelling etc. And for all of the remaining bits and pieces, SAP BTP has always been the best option from SAP Build to SAP Integration Suite. With SAP Document AI, we have a leader in document processing with inbound and outbound channels, and SAP AI Core a powerful AI orchestration service at low costs each.

While you can get other services cheaper somewhere, the TCO of this toolbox is imho astonishingly low. And for building this scenario from mobile device intake to equipment in S/4, I just needed a day to configure and build without pro-code needed. Happy AI-2026...

entry.title: From Docs to Dialogue: Unlock AI Self-Service Learning for Your Internal Teams
entry.content:
From Docs to Dialogue: Unlock AI Self-Service Learning for Your Internal Teams

  • Every organization wants onboarding to be faster, clearer, and less dependent on tribal knowledge.
  • NotebookLM enables the conversion of trusted product documentation and internal project artifacts into an AI-based conversational resource that employees can engage with naturally, as if they were chatting with their most knowledgeable coworker. Instead of searching across files, PDFs, and web pages, teams can ask direct questions about product behavior, setup requirements, and configuration considerations, and instantly turn answers into internal training materials.
  • This AI-driven approach
    • scales knowledge without replacing expertise
    • streamlines learning without adding process overhead
    • helps organizations build deeper product fluency internally
 

Table of Contents

  • Benefits & Use Cases
  • Gathering Trusted Knowledge
  • SAP Product Documentation
  • Other relevant documentation
  • Getting Started with NotebookLM
  • Chatbot-Driven Learning
  • Generating Internal Training Assets
  • Audio Overview: podcast interview for auditory learning
  • Infographic: a one-stop shop PDF for visual learning
  • Video Overview: a training video for visual learning
  • Flashcards and Quizzes: A hands-on tool for your team to learn
  • Best Practices
  • End-to-End overview
  • A real-world example, see NotebookLM in action
  • Prompt
  • Infographic
  • Video Overview
  • Chatbot Response
  • Considerations & Final Takeaways

Benefits & Use Cases

  • Faster employee ramp-up by turning existing SAP Documentation into a conversational AI learning environment
  • Instant answers for distributed teams across roles, experience levels, and time zones
  • Improved configuration confidence through real-time dialogue with authoritative sources
  • Consistent onboarding experiences that reduce knowledge gaps between new hires
  • Rapid training asset creation (FAQs, slide outlines, learning summaries) generated directly from source material
  • Search less, learn more‚Äîteams ask questions instead of digging across files and folders.
  • More informed internal experts because foundational questions get answered efficiently and consistently
  • Support interactions become more efficient and solution-focused when they happen, backed by deeper internal product fluency.

Gathering Trusted Knowledge

To begin using NoteBookLM as your AI Self-Service learning tool, you must first gather all of the relevant knowledge on the specific SAP product you are looking to focus on. These will become your sources within NotebookLM and will act as the knowledge base that NotebookLM uses as it guides your 

The free version of NotebookLM is limited to 50 sources, so please consider this as you capture your list of sources

SAP Product Documentation

https://help.sap.com/docs/ contains all relevant product documentation for your SAP products and is the best place to start gathering the content you need. 

  1. Go to SAP Help   
  2. Search for the specific SAP product you are looking to hone in on and then click on the Suggested Product that most aligns with your search.   
    Example: SAP Business Network for Procurement 
  3. In the bottom right corner of the top banner, click Download PDF 
  4. Select all relevant options from the pop-up page, then click Download at the bottom of the page 

Other relevant documentation

In addition to the standard SAP Product Documentation, you can gather information from various sources, including webpages, documents, PDFs, video transcripts, and raw text.

Consult with your internal security and compliance teams to review the NotebookLM terms of service before interacting with any non-public documentation 

  • SOPs (standard operating procedures) for business processes 
  • configuration specifications and customization designs
  • Project planning and scope documentation 
  • public-facing / external blogs or training content on the product or business process (YouTube videos, Blogs, industry journals, etc.) 
  • Product demos or training recording transcripts 
  • Company branding information 

Getting Started with NotebookLM

Now that you have all your sources prepared, you can begin uploading them to NotebookLM. 

  1. Open NotebookLM and complete the onboarding process to create a free account. This will be tied to your Gmail/Google account. Please consult your internal teams regarding any enterprise plans or privacy concerns.
  2. Create a new notebook, selecting the + Create New button
  3. Upload the files that you captured in the previous step by clicking Upload Files
  4. Allow your sources to load. Once complete, you should see all your sources displayed in the left panel.
  5. To share your notebook with other colleagues, you can click the Share button in the top right of the page. 

Chatbot-Driven Learning

In the middle section of the page, you can interact with the notebook via Chat, as if you were talking with a product expert. 

  • NotebookLM will then use AI to develop an answer, intentionally prioritizing your repository of sources to provide the proper context and deliver the best answer to your question.
  • Within the AI-generated response, you will notice that small numbers with circles around them are displayed throughout the answer. You can click these, and then the left panel will take you directly into the specific source document where it pulled that part of the answer from
  • For a more visual approach, you can also click the Mind Map option in the Studio panel. Once generated, you can click to view a visual representation of the sources you uploaded. As you click deeper into the mind map, the chat will auto-update and help kick-start a conversation you can use to drill down into a specific topic area. 

As with any AI LLM-based tool, results may vary and should be reviewed in detail by your teams for accuracy. 

You can continue your conversation with the AI chatbot by asking it

  • additional clarifying questions specific to your needs
  • reframing your question in more complete wording to provide more context
  • to drill down deeper into specific areas of its response 
  • to drill down deeper into specific documents/sources 
  • Additional documentation 

Generating Internal Training Assets

The right portion of the page, called Studio, will include options (depending on your plan) to generate content tailored to your team's training and enablement needs. 

For each option in the studio, click the Pencil icon to customize the result by providing a prompt that guides the studio's content generation and is tailored to your needs.

  • If you do not click the pencil, it will auto-generate based on all your sources. Depending on the size and scope of your sources, the output may be too high-level without a custom prompt provided. 

Each Studio option may also provide its own set of configuration toggles in addition to a custom prompt.

Each option also includes a Download option, allowing you to export any generated content to your internal libraries or training tools. 

Audio Overview: podcast interview for auditory learning

The audio overview option generates a one-on-one podcast interview between two people who discuss your sources and/or your custom prompt. You can use this to create targeted podcasts that dive into specific areas, then include them in onboarding materials for teams who prefer an Auditory format. 

*Pro Tip: upload your own transcript or outline of how you would like the conversation to go. This will help guide the model to create an interview that covers the areas you consider essential, rather than guessing what to highlight. 

*Pro Tip: When providing your custom prompt, include specifics as to how you would like the tone of the speakers to be. By default, the podcasts may seem a bit exaggerated at times. You can ask the prompt to use more normal and realistic tones and/or ask it to avoid certain words like "massive" or "huge", for example 

Infographic: a one-stop shop PDF for visual learning

The infographic will create a one-pager PDF with AI-generated visuals that provide a more "connect the dots" overview of the sources. It will start with a high-level overview that connects all sources (similar to a Mind Map), but if you provide a specific prompt, it can also provide a more refined overview of that topic area. 

*Pro Tip: check the visual for any discrepancies. If you see issues, recreate the infographic by changing your custom prompt to call out the mistake you want to avoid. The more specifics you provide, the better 

*Pro Tip: In your custom prompt, call out the audience that will be consuming the graphic itself. It can tailor the messaging and graphic style to better suit that audience. You can also ask it to reference a branding source if you have uploaded one that includes logos, color schemes, etc. 

Video Overview: a training video for visual learning

The video overview will provide a more traditional training format, with one speaker presenting the topic while an AI-generated video plays in the background. The video will resemble a PowerPoint presentation. You can use this to create a high-level video overview of the sources, or to provide a custom prompt that goes into one area in more detail. 

*Pro Tip: The graphics or numbers on the video itself need to be reviewed for accuracy. If you see discrepancies between what is displayed and what is mentioned in the video, you will need to refine your custom prompt and regenerate the video to close the gap. The more specific you are (e.g., an outline or script and dos and don'ts), the better the results you will get. You are unable to edit the video itself or adjust the slides/visuals after it is generated 

Flashcards and Quizzes: A hands-on tool for your team to learn 

The Flashcards option searches for primary and recurring keywords and definitions in your sources and automatically generates flashcards to help learners study/memorize key terms. 

The Quiz option will also search for primary and recurring keywords across the sources and generate an interactive question-and-answer quiz. 

*Quizzes cannot be downloaded externally 

Best Practices

  • Depending on your sources and the sheer volume of data within the notebook, the AI Models can and will hallucinate. Having detailed, specific prompts to guide each conversation or studio creation toward a specific goal will produce the best results. It is better to break your content needs into smaller groupings with detailed prompts than to blindly ask it to create high-level overviews. 
  • Be sure to consult with your internal privacy and compliance teams before uploading any non-public information into NotebookLM. As a general rule, only upload publicly available content to NotebookLM. 
  • YouTube videos can be effective at providing an additional perspective through a more expert-focused, human-guided lens on your dataset of sources. Collect long-form YouTube interviews with experts in your area and upload the URLs as additional sources to your notebook. 
  • Create your own scripts or outlines beforehand and provide those to the chat or studio in addition to your primary ask it. This will help ensure it follows the correct path you are looking for and does not hallucinate. You can also use other LLMs or AI Chatbots to help you come up with ideas and draft a high-level script or outline to follow. 
  • If you share your notebook with end users, ensure they understand that chatbot results must be reviewed and refined to provide guidance that helps kick-start an investigation into a topic. End users should be wary of copying/pasting AI-generated content externally. 

End-to-End overview

Find your product at SAP Help

Download the SAP product documentation to PDF 

Create a notebook and upload files to NotebookLM 

Observe your sources and begin interacting with the chatbot & studio

A real-world example, see NotebookLM in action

The SAP Business Network for Procurement is used globally to connect buyers and suppliers and enable interaction and transactions. This results in a variety of country-specific invoicing laws and portals that vary by country. The application itself includes standard invoicing features and built-in support for various country-specific E-Invoicing mandates. 

In this example, we will investigate how we can learn more about this topic using NotebookLM with a single prompt to generate a text answer, an infographic, and a video overview file. 

Prompt

I want to learn more about e-invoicing and country-specific invoicing rules within the SBN for the Procurement application. My team has a basic understanding of the core SBN Procurement flows, but is seeking more guidance on the e-invoicing and country-specific invoicing logic and features within the product. Can you help produce content that clarifies this for us and explains the topic in detail as it relates to the larger product? Id like to know what is supported in the app, how i would interact with these features, if there are any specific setup or customization requirements to use this, and a list of which countries are currently supported. 
The audience here is a group of corporate employees who know procurement as a whole. Keep things professional and short/sweet. Don't use any exaggerations and don't overhype with any big, bold words. Use simpler, down-to-earth professional wording. 

Infographic

Video Overview

 

Chatbot Response

Here is an overview of how SAP Business Network (SBN) handles e-invoicing and country-specific compliance.

In the context of the Procurement application, e-invoicing on SBN goes beyond emailing a PDF. The system uses structured data (cXML) to validate invoices against your business rules and the legal regulations of the supplier‚Äôs country before the invoice reaches your internal systems.

The core feature that manages this is Country/Region-Based Invoice Rules. When a supplier submits an invoice, SBN detects the originating country based on the supplier‚Äôs VAT ID prefix or address, then applies a specific set of validation rules that override default transaction rules. This ensures that suppliers in different countries ‚Äî for example Italy vs the United States ‚Äî see different required fields and localized behaviors.

The platform supports several compliance models depending on the region.

For VAT-regulated regions, particularly in the EU, Australia, and Canada, SBN enforces required tax information such as VAT IDs, supply dates, tax breakdowns, and local currency requirements.

In countries using government clearance models, where the government must approve an invoice before the buyer receives it, SBN integrates directly with national invoice platforms. Examples include KSeF (Poland), SDI (Italy), and the E-Invoice system (India).

SBN automatically applies digital signatures to invoices for many countries to ensure document integrity and authenticity.

The system also converts standard cXML invoice data into legally mandated formats required by specific governments or networks. Examples include FatturaPA (Italy) and Peppol UBL (supported in countries such as Belgium and Singapore).

Buyers interact with these features primarily through configuration rather than manual invoice transactions.

To configure rules, buyers navigate to Country-Based Invoice Rules within the Administration and Configuration settings. Here, countries can be activated and compliance requirements can be enabled or disabled, such as requiring suppliers to send tax invoice documents.

Buyers can monitor invoice submission status in their inbox. For government-connected countries, invoice history will include status updates showing government validation progress and results.

Buyers can also generate compliance visibility through built-in reporting. One example is the Supplier Legal Profile report, which shows which suppliers have completed the required tax compliance setup for their country or region.

Suppliers see a dynamic invoice creation experience based on their country. During invoice creation, suppliers are shown required local tax fields based on their location ‚Äî for example GST IDs and HSN codes in India, or Stamp Duty fields in Italy.

Suppliers in countries with strict mandates must complete a Legal Profile or Country Configuration in their account settings. This is where they enter tax registration numbers and upload any required digital certificates or identifiers for government or network compliance.

To enable these features in an SBN Buyer account, buyers must update Default Transaction Rules to allow country-based invoice rules to take precedence instead of being ignored.

Buyers must also add and activate the specific countries they trade with in Country-Based Invoice Rules.

For countries that route invoices through external networks like Peppol, buyers must register their Peppol Participant ID or equivalent identifier in their profile so suppliers can send invoices successfully.

For countries where SBN retrieves invoices directly from government portals (inbound invoice flow), buyers must configure External Document Service settings to establish a connection with the national tax authority. Examples include Poland and Romania.

SBN supports country-specific compliance logic, VAT validation, or government integration for the following countries.

Americas: Brazil, Canada, Chile, Colombia, Mexico, Peru, United States.

Asia/Pacific: Australia, China, India, Japan, Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan, Thailand.

Europe: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Russia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, Ukraine, United Kingdom.

Middle East/Africa: Israel, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, UAE.

Considerations & Final Takeaways

Every organization wants onboarding to be faster, clearer, and built on trusted knowledge rather than fragmented internal know-how. NotebookLM enables teams to convert authoritative product documentation, SOPs, configuration specs, SOWs, demos, and project artifacts into a secure AI-powered conversational resource that employees can interact with naturally‚Äîlike chatting with their most knowledgeable coworker. Instead of manually searching across files and web pages, teams can ask direct questions about product capabilities, setup requirements, and configuration considerations, then instantly convert those answers into internal enablement assets such as training outlines, FAQs, flashcards, infographics, and learning summaries. When setting up your NotebookLM hub, prioritize source quality, clear document labeling, and intentional prompting during training to reduce ambiguity and improve accuracy. This approach scales product fluency across teams, streamlines learning without adding process overhead, and creates more confident, self-sufficient users‚Äîwhile ensuring that expert conversations, when needed, are informed, efficient, and outcome-driven.

entry.title: From Hype to Hands-On: Level Up Your AI Skills This January
entry.content:
In the age of AI, the skills we build today will define how we work tomorrow. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve launched a monthly series of blogs that spotlight the latest AI learning assets and upcoming learning opportunities. This blog explores the latest learning and enablement resources on SAP Document AI, as well as the bi-directional integration between Joule and Microsoft 365 Copilot. We also dive into some key resources to help you get started building your own Joule agents.

Building on my first blog, where I introduced you to our AI live sessions Beyond Hype (which is all about getting productive with SAP Business AI), I wanted to address some of your most asked questions:

  1. How can I enable SAP Document AI on my mobile device?
    SAP Document AI also supports mobile use cases, ideally for employees working remotely or in the field who need to submit documents while on the go. Within SAP Mobile Start, you can configure Document AI as a target, then take a picture and automatically upload it for processing. Find out here how to integrate and launch SAP Document AI on mobile. If you haven‚Äôt set up SAP Document AI yet, you want to check out the steps here.

    Did you know about the recent feature release: Inbound and outbound channel support, which allows you to connect your e-mail server, as many document-related use cases involve e-mail. For now, only Microsoft Outlook is supported, but this enables you to fetch the e-mail, extract both the e-mail body and attachments, such as Excel files. For e-mail ingestion, you don‚Äôt need BPA integration; you can also use our e-mail ingestion feature without BPA by configuring your e-mail inbox as an inbound channel in our UI. Read more about the Q4/25 Release Highlights here and follow the documentation to register an e-mail app here.

    Stay up to date with SAP Road Map Explorer and learn how you will benefit from SAP Document AI in upcoming releases.

  2. Where can we find instructions for setting up the bi-directional integration between Joule and Microsoft 365 Copilot?
    The great thing is that you can get started today with Joule Base and a Microsoft 365 license by downloading the SAP Joule app from the Microsoft Marketplace (M365 Copilot license required when using M365 Copilot skills in Joule web client in your SAP Application). Then follow the SAP Help documentation to set up the connection between Cloud Identity Services on SAP BTP & Microsoft Entra, and consider a few technical pre-requisites:
    1.  Is Joule activated in at least one SAP Business Applications (e.g., SAP SuccessFactors or SAP S/4HANA Cloud), and do you have administrator access to SAP Cloud Identity Services, SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), and Microsoft Entra? Yes? Great, read on!
    2.  Next, you need to:
    • Configure Microsoft Entra as your Corporate Identity Provider
    • Enable Joule to Pass Requests to Microsoft Copilot and Teams
    • Joule Formation to be included with MS Copilot Integration in your system landscape

     Watch my colleague @nageshcaparthy  demo the setup process! 

     

  3. May we use Joule within Microsoft 365 Copilot (and vice versa) when handling confidential data?
    Did you know that Joule and Copilot are only exchanging the user prompt and displaying the result in their respective UIs? Through Identity Propagation between Microsoft Entra and Cloud Identity Services on SAP BTP, Joule and Microsoft 365 Copilot are aware of a user‚Äôs roles and permissions for a secure integration. Watch the video and see the two Copilots work together in action! 

     

Want to dive deeper into the content? Rewatch the sessions and access the session material via SAP Learning Hub (subscription required):

  • Getting Started with SAP Document AI: Activate, Automate, Act (recording)
  • Two Copilots, One Goal: Smarter Productivity with Joule and Microsoft 365 Copilot (recording)

Speaking of automation and productivity, have you heard that Agent builder in Joule Studio is now generally available? The agent builder enables developers to create Joule agents tailored to their unique business requirements, breaking cross-ecosystem silos and reducing barriers to AI adoption. Read on in Michael Ameling‚Äôs Blog, President of SAP Business Technology Platform, to explore key highlights of the release, everyday use cases for Joule agents, and get insights into the roadmap. 

Here are your key resources to help you get started building your own Joule agents:

  • How to Get Started with Joule Studio: Prerequisites, Commercials, and Instructions to begin using Joule Studio 
  • Joule Studio Goes Live: Answers to Your Top Questions covering Skills and the new Agent Builder features 
  • Create an Agent in Joule Studio: Step-by-step tutorial on how to build and test an agent in Joule Studio
  • Best Practices for Building Agents: Key principles and practices for designing effective Joule Agents 
  • Discovery Center Mission: Get Hands-on experience in creating a Joule Agent with multiple skills and MCP

Hi Joule, where should I get started with the latest learning resources? *

Apart from live enablement sessions, explore our latest on-demand learning resources:

  • To all partners: Test, demo, and develop with Joule and Microsoft 365 Copilot by purchasing the Joule Base TDD entitlement (8020592) and any Microsoft 365 environment (you don't necessarily need M365 Copilot to get started). Check out the Microsoft 365 Developer Program to get started.
  • Get hands-on with SAP Document AI! Pre-configured content is automatically delivered as part of the application and can be activated in the schema UI or via the schema APIs. In the video, you will learn how to create your own schemas from scratch in the SAP Document AI workspace. Now it‚Äôs your turn - Go ahead and try it yourself! 

     

* Powered by the machine learning technology of SAP AI Business Services, personalized recommendations are generated for employees, in one place on the Learning home page, based on employee data.
